programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts scrutinise prehistoric ruins, asking whether humans could have built such advanced structures alone, and examine the possibility of alien intervention.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a ring that once belonged to notorious 1930s gangster Lucky Luciano and a letter signed by a famous American football coach.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Huntington Beach for a night-time auction. Mary and Ivy get into a heated bidding war, while Dave looks to score big or go home.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his dad to the auction, leading to comical developments, while Ivy goes in big despite carrying an injury.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Fat Lady Is Warming Up
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi look to coast through the auctions, but end up having a marathon. Darrell faces the auction without Brandon to back him up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit the Palm Springs desert hoping for some hot profits. Mary sticks to a tight budget while Darrell is willing to spend big.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A careless mistake threatens the safety of DJ and Cody, and it begins to look as though Jimmy's first dive will also be his last.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Melvyn's gung-ho attitude puts the crew in danger, Jimmy tries to avoid an encounter with an alligator and the Swamp Man fights his way through debris from Hurricane Katrina.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: An insight into what the US government is doing to protect its people, from atomic attacks to cyber warfare and deadly airborne viruses.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: An eye-opening look into the mysteries and allure of scientology in which former practitioners reveal what drew them to the Church, and why they chose to leave.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Aliens and the Creation of Man
programme.desc: Can unexplained advances in human evolution be attributed to alien architects? Giorgio Tsoukalos joines forces with alien theorists to look at the evidence.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts study previous reports of zombies, vampires and spirits and question whether the sightings of the undead have actually been alien encounters.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler make plans for Rick's stag night, and the team restores a three-wheeled all-terrain vehicle.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick cannot refuse when a stock car racer asks him to repair a 1970s motorcycle, but may have taken on more than he can handle.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is delighted to discover a car that once belonged to Elvis, while Kevin and the team prepare another surprise for him.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A regular customer brings a furry friend to the shop, and a man offers the guys a timepiece that was once owned by Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie is offered the chance to buy one of Elvis Presley's teeth, and Johnnie comes across an unusual Batman puppet.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth continue continue their tense stand-off, but a demanding customer forces them to band together. A signed and authenticated Elvis record stimulates interest, but Les and Rich are wary of paying too much for it.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit an upmarket retirement community, where Darrell Sheets buys a unit filled with furniture, and Jarrod Schulz takes a gamble on a safe.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys get a taste of the Wild West when they value a 19th-century revolver. They also examine a set of Elvis Presley's medical records.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a collection of vintage toy cars, a pair of First World War German Pickelhaube helmets and a necklace once owned by Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Members of the team get their hands on a rare photograph of Albert Einstein and a collection of top-secret documents from the Pentagon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys interview applicants for the night shift position and examine a valuable first edition of David Thoreau's classic book Walden.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to make a deal on a guitar signed by Crosby, Stills & Nash, and also examines a pair of bomb fins from the Second World War.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod reveals to Brandi that he has an alter ego, while Ivy attends auctions in Moreno Valley.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey tries to restrain Rene's spending habits, while Darrell and Brandon rely on their intuition to beat the competition. Elsewhere, Ivy plans to spy on Jarrod and Brandi's buying strategy.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell plays pranks on his rivals to distract them from the best lockers, Rene and Casey have a disagreement, and Ivy is excited by the items on offer.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi test a bidding strategy, while Darrell and Brandon are under pressure to find merchandise for their website.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: It's Bring Your Kids to Work Day
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi take their children to an auction during spring break, while Darrell puts his 'Gambler' nickname to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have some fun as they attempt to beat the competition, while Casey tries her hand at bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Revisiting the most memorable finds from Storage Wars history, including one alarming discovery that has never been seen before.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the biggest mistakes made by bidders in the series' history - as well as previously unseen footage of an explosive argument.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths head to a scrap yard to create their signature blades, then recreate a fearsome battle weapon known as the kampilan.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: At Smith's Cove, Rick and Marty Lagina are excited to find an item that dates back as far as a century before the discovery of the Money Pit.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters adopt some unusual tactics to recover from a run of bad luck, and one team goes in search of a rogue gator that has been preying on farmers' livestock.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
programme.desc: A series of interlinked stories about the Los Angeles underworld. A hitman plays minder to his boss's wife, and he and his partner deal with a dead body following a mishap with a gun. Meanwhile, a washed-up boxer goes on the run after refusing to throw a fight, and two lovers plot a hold-up in a diner. Quentin Tarantino's crime drama, starring John Travolta, Samuel L Jackson, Uma Thurman, Bruce Willis, Ving Rhames, Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian discusses hotel soap, kinky cages and food that gets a bit too familiar.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined by Jonathan Ross, Germaine Greer, Tom Wrigglesworth and Lucy Beaumont for lively debate on offbeat subject matters.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim have two wheelie bins full of junk and just three days to create a spectacular moment with a pro athlete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Andrew and Kevin build a floating hot tub, which the boys can take out onto the lake with their cans.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: The boys fuse a smoke shack with a bourbon bar, so they can hit the booze while they are preparing dinner.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event which comes from the Cauberg, a hill in the southern town of Valkenburg, Holland.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: The largest big-top circus tent in the UK needs to move town, but with 22 artic lorries to fill with gear, the teams need to work late into the night to stay on schedule.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A police pursuit results in a car being driven the wrong way up the M1. Reports emerge of two youths on mopeds threatening a man with a knife.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Following an ANPR ping, Stu assists with an armed vehicle stop believed to be connected to a firearms incident in Gloucester. PC Parkes visits a woman who failed to hand herself in.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Beer Silo, Plane Bar, Steam Train
programme.desc: A 32-metre long beer tank must navigate tiny roads to be installed at a brewery in Tadcaster, while in Kidderminster, a vintage steam train travels hundreds of miles south to Devon.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick through a collection of American Civil War memorabilia, and also find a rare motorcycle engine.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Impressionist and actor Alistair McGowan, former Dragons' Den businesswoman Hilary Devey and singer Josh Groban compete to have their pet hates banished, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include supermarkets, the smoking ban, Valentine's Day and people who treat animals like humans.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace, sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedienne Sarah Millican join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to banish their pet hates - which include people at cashpoints, barbecues, shop assistants, buffets and anti-social cats - to the infamous room.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes TV presenter Fern Britton, comic actor Robert Webb and broadcaster Danny Baker to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event which comes from the Cauberg, a hill in the southern town of Valkenburg, Holland.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A Cuban woman crosses the bridge in the hope of being granted political asylum in America, while officers in Laredo stop three students carrying something unusual in their car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Customs and Border Protection officers think they have spotted a trend when they seize drugs from behind the dashboards of two cars. A Mexican woman asks officers for protection.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Broadcaster David Dimbleby takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with investigative journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Holly Walsh and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show, with questions touching on the world's deadliest hunter, a photographer hidden inside an ox, and a juggling otter. As ever, the panellists face fiendishly difficult questions, and points are awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Nathan Caton, Greg Davies and Micky Flanagan join host Dara O Briain and regular panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for another round of the satirical news quiz. First aired in June 2012.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sarah Millican, Tom Allen, Arj Barker
programme.desc: Sarah Millican plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Tom Allen and Arj Barker.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Skeleton analysis is used to uncover more about medieval life, with this instalment focusing on a well-preserved knight found in St Bees, Cumbria. Presented by Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The 1415 Battle of Agincourt and its Band of Brothers. Henry V's victory against a numerically superior French army ushered in a new period in the Hundred Years' War.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Tim Sutherland makes numerous discoveries as bones from the 1385 Battle of Aljubarrota, in which Portugal defeated the Crown of Castile, are forensically examined.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Carbon dating of a skeleton found in East Sussex suggests the bones are from the Norman era, leading experts to consider whether the medieval man fought at the Battle of Hastings.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history, beginning with a man from Bermondsey who vanished without trace in 1849.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Examining the 1966 murders of three police officers in Shepherd's Bush that led to a huge manhunt and calls for the death penalty to be reinstated.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Yvette and Edith both question Ren about the whereabouts of the gold, while the Colonel and Gruber search the caf for the missing Enigma machine.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General von Klinkerhoffen visits the vineyard where Rene and the Resistance are working, and jeopardises their scheme to return the British airmen home.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: The Gestapo for the High Jump
programme.desc: Rene learns that the Gestapo are plotting to disguise themselves as British airmen - prompting General Von Klinkerhoffen to adopt a similar plan for Captain Bertorelli's soldiers. Later, the cafe owner and his workers dress up as characters from horror films to fool Herr Flick.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh returns to his Bafta-winning role of the Swedish detective in three adaptations of stories by Henning Mankell. Wallander moves into a new home with his girlfriend, only for their dreams of domestic bliss to be shattered when they discover a skeleton in the garden. He must find the killer if he has any hopes of getting his life settled again - and is surprised to discover the body was buried more recently than he first thought. Saskia Reeves and Sarah Smart co-star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Barrister James Kavanagh (John Thaw) tries to clear an Oxbridge undergraduate accused of raping a housewife, but his home life begins to interfere with work and the cracks in his marriage to independent and successful wife Lizzie re-emerge. First episode of the legal drama, guest starring Ewan McGregor, with Alison Steadman, Lisa Harrow and Anna Chancellor.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Montford host Jack's film premiere, where Evie meets an attractive Treasury minister. Period drama, starring Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Finlay temporarily hangs up his stethoscope to intervene in a confrontation between Irish farm labourers and irate locals who blame them for a typhus outbreak, and resolves matters with a combination of tough talking and common sense. David Rintoul stars, with Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim's gambling habit looks like it's about to be exposed when he's spotted at a dog track by Steve and Honey, while Terry arrests his own brother on a trumped-up charge, determined to discover whether he's really abusing his sons. Elsewhere, an act of vandalism at a church leads Tony to a wholly unexpected encounter with another of the Radford boys - has this scion of the notorious crime family really become a man of the cloth?.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry is beside himself with worry about his nephews' safety, convinced they are being abused by his brother, and jeopardises the case to help them. Meadows attends the funeral of former colleague Ted Roach, and is drawn into investigating the suspicious circumstances surrounding his death, helped by ex-coppers Bob Cryer and Alec Peters. Questioning his own mortality in the process, he wonders whether a quieter pace of life would suit him better, but soon realises he would miss the thrill of the job and sets off home in a more positive mood - until he gets a shooting pain down his arm.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil speedily steps into a convalescing Jack Meadows' shoes, much to the dismay of Debbie McAllister, who takes a dim view of his unseemly haste to take over. Rob organises a disastrous raid on the Radfords' club, while Samantha receives a video of missing daughter Abi, belatedly bringing Phil Hunter round to the view that the youngster has been kidnapped.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina orders Kerry to sever her ties with the Radford family or leave the Met. The Sun Hill sniper claims another victim, raising fears that he's being fed information by a police insider - or may actually work at the station. Behind the scenes, Gabriel gleefully seizes an opportunity to cause renewed friction between Jim and June.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Patricia Routledge stars as Lancashire housewife Hetty Wainthropp, a part-time Post Office worker with a sideline in sleuthing. In this first episode, the mysterious death of a pensioner leaves a few unanswered questions, but Hetty smells a rat and with her young assistant Geoffrey, sets about solving the mystery the police have little interest in. Drama, also starring Dominic Monaghan and David Benfield.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Hetty and amiable sidekick Geoffrey become embroiled in a convoluted case involving a deaf birdwatcher who goes missing at the same time as a woman's body is found at the bottom of a cliff he is known to frequent. Light-hearted drama, with Patricia Routledge and Dominic Monaghan, featuring a guest appearance by David Bower.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The owners of a Tuscan inn are sent a severed finger and a photo of their son. Convinced he has been kidnapped by the Mafia, their daughter hires Hetty while she and Robert are on holiday.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki struggles to come to terms with life back home and seeks out fellow pathologist Sally Vaughan for support, only to learn she is nowhere to be found. National Crime Agency investigator Guy Bernhardt asks Nikki to help him by employing pathologist David Cannon, the chief suspect in Sally's disappearance. As Jack, Clarissa and Thomas share concerns about Nikki's wellbeing, a body found in a reservoir is linked to a murder case from 16 years previously. Return of the crime drama, starring Emilia Fox, with Julian Rhind-Tutt and Alex Macqueen.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd is unsettled when Sarah Cavendish (played by Five Daughters star Eva Birthistle), an officer of equal rank to him, joins the team to investigate the disappearance of a banker who had been struggling to cope with losing his daughter to cancer. Though Cavendish's professional skills quickly prove to be a major asset, her new colleagues discover that a failed operation from earlier in her career is continuing to haunt her, and become concerned for her welfare. Trevor Eve stars in the first of a two-part story kicking off the final series of the crime drama, with Sue Johnston and Tara Fitzgerald.

programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Jones.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon teams up with Paddy McGuinness to remake Steven Spielberg's 1993 dinosaur-based classic Jurassic Park. The duo are helped by Sian Gibson, Sally Phillips, George Potts, Shaun Ryder and Bernie Clifton to reimagine the story of genetically engineered dinosaurs that escape from an eccentric tycoon's safari park and go on the rampage.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Boxing promoter Kellie Maloney throws a dinner party for four strangers at her Essex home. Brian McFadden hosts the game show where diners try to guess the identity of a mystery host holding a dinner party in order to win a cash prize.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: When a dragon chases the Trolls from their cave and they have nowhere to live, Ruby does not want to help them; she then discovers that their cave is filled with diamonds.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Gordon responds to an emergency along the Supreme Barrier Reef. The Tracy brothers once again set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood in an updated version of the show.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare will see him attempt a bungee jump, but has he got the nerve to launch himself off the side of the Tees Transporter bridge?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Butch breaks up with his girlfriend, Tom, Jerry, and Tuffy work to bring them back together so Butch won't go after Toodles.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom gets a can of Cat Cop, a spray that creates a tiny cop that chases Jerry around.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When the gang find an air hockey table in the garage, it's cats versus mice in an epic game of hockey!.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo takes Fizz for a toy containing top secret information, which he steals from a secret agent, but it's actually just weasel..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean enters Scrapper into a beauty contest so that he can win First Prize: a trip with Irma to Paris..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave demands to go on a foreign exchange. He soon finds himself headed for a week-long stay in a flat a few doors down..

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: Four pandas absorb the mystical Hero Chi of the Four Constellation, before seeking the Dragon Master as their teacher..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet looks forward to a healthy new year, baking savoury breakfast muffins, granola protein bars and a plant-based cacti and succulents cake. TV's Dr Ranj Singh serves up a healthy five-vegetable lasagne, and Juliet meets a vegan cheese producer.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: With Christmas behind them, John Torode and Lisa Faulkner present some light and fresh recipes to kick off the new year. They start with home-made granola and stewed fruit, Lisa makes a one-pot vegetarian pasta dish and a spiced cod tray bake and John demonstrates pearl barley with an array of mushrooms.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by chef Eran Tibi to dish up a family feast from the Middle East. The menu comprises an Israeli mezze of stuffed brick and sweet potato hummus for breakfast, mussakhan for lunch, Eran's aubergine, tomato and beef stew for dinner and Nadia's cigar baklava with cheat's pistachio ice cream for dessert.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor joins the show as the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. In the first episode, Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong make up the panel, trying to identify the performers inside a bee, a duck, a unicorn, a hedgehog, a butterfly and a chameleon.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as TV presenters Donna Air, Amanda Lamb, Sarah Greene and Dan Snow pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following on from the launch show over Christmas, Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the start of the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and new addition John 'Fabulous' Barrowman. This year's celebrities - six of whom will perform tonight - are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely and Trisha Goddard and - in the show's first same-sex partnership - Ian 'H' Watkins. Michael Barrymore was due to compete, but a broken wrist has ruled him out, and he is replaced by Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Another six unknown celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The mystery contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the second celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Actress-writer Ruth Jones, comedian and actor Johnny Vegas and boxing star David Haye take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them 1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug (2013)
programme.desc: The party of dwarves and their hobbit ally continue the quest to reclaim their lost kingdom, journeying through the forest home of ancestral enemy the elves and finally facing the dragon that drove them from their home. Meanwhile, Gandalf the wizard investigates the rise of a mysterious dark power. Part two of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: The documentary series looks into the so-called 'space fireflies', which reportedly attack astronauts' brains.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Are Aliens Attacking Our Nuclear Arsenal?
programme.desc: An examination of what aliens' motives could be following numerous accounts of senior military personnel witnessing UFOs above nuclear weapons bases.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons, oversees the battle between The Streeties from London and The Newton Grange from Durham.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of some of the most daring drivers who take speed to the next levels. Featuring unusual pedestrians and a party on wheels like no other.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic complication of some of the most outrageous and dangerous misadventures on wheels. From faulty designs to stunts gone wrong, the crazy real-life footage is endless.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: The fiery crash of a Nasa aircraft puts Neil Armstrong's life at risk, while a tornado rips a Canadian farm from its foundations. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An extreme skier is swept up in an avalanche, window washers cling on for their lives during a violent storm and Robbie Knievel's motorbike stunt goes wrong in Hawaii.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The Goblin Works Garage gang opens a bigger workshop to cope with demand, going bolder than ever before with design and restoration work.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: In 1976 John converted his van himself. Now his daughter wishes to see it returned to its former glory, so calls in the help of the Overhaulin' crew.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: The series exploring the design and construction of supercars looks at the Dodge Viper.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: The design and construction of a Porsche, and a look at the work of engineers who are setting out to build a hybrid supercar.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado, Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for an epic motoring mission as the pair scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The Goblin Works Garage gang opens a bigger workshop to cope with demand, going bolder than ever before with design and restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads for Turin to buy a Fiat 500, but the only way to get it back to the UK is to drive it, and the engine is in need of urgent attention.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to France to buy a bargain Citroen, but back in the workshop Edd China finds chronic problems with its self-levelling suspension.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Iron Resurrection team tears into a '62 Chevy Truck. Joe Martin wants to create a custom Lowrider so radical it scrapes the ground..

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin and the team resurrect a 1953 Ford Ranch wagon, but a heart-stopping shop accident could turn the dream into a nightmare.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin has big plans for a '64 Lincoln Continental, but a faulty steering column threatens to turn this quick flip into a never-ending money pit.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A black Cadillac '64 Coupe De Ville Convertible fires up Joe Martin's imagination, and he hopes a new stance, wide wheels and a killer paint job will bring customers running.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The team restores a scorched '73 Pontiac Firebird, but it remains to be seen whether Joe, Shag, and Amanda will be able to resurrect this barbecued bird.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda find a '47 International Milk truck that needs resurrecting, and a customer brings in his '55 Chevy Race car for a paint job.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer visits Idaho to buy a Karmann Ghia, but a broken gearbox and damaged interior could stop him and Edd China from making a profit on the sale of the restored vehicle.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits an upmarket Somerset showroom and buys a scruffy table full of potential. In Lancashire, he spots a Swedish design classic and a Soviet relic of the Cold War.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Cornish castle, Drew Pritchard digs out beach buckets and toy trucks. Later, his friend Stuart sells off his renowned collection of car memorabilia - and Drew has first dibs.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The Goblin Works Garage gang opens a bigger workshop to cope with demand, going bolder than ever before with design and restoration work.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, whose staff are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, whose staff are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Mummy's Little Murderer
programme.desc: On May 7, 2011, 20-year-old Elliot Turner strangled his girlfriend Emily Longley and persuaded his doting parents to help him cover up the crime. This documentary examines events surrounding the murder, the investigation and the trial, and features interviews with family, friends, police and prosecutors, as well as covert recordings, surveillance footage and personal archive material.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators who use minute scraps of evidence to discover the full story behind a murder and solve serious crimes.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The story of how after becoming inspired by countless horror films, including Scream, two teenagers terrorised and brutally stabbed to death a female classmate employing iconic horror movie tropes in their act.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.sub-title: Roses Are Red, Murder Is Too
programme.desc: The death of a town council member. Local residents were appalled - especially when the evidence began to suggest a professional 'hit' had taken place.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Examining a murder investigation in which police turned to the FBI's crime laboratory after encountering difficulties in identifying a woman's body.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Examining the work of animal police in the city of San Francisco. Scott rescues a dehydrated pit bull puppy that was left muzzled and chained in the back of a hot car.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown x-rays a dog and confirms she is expecting puppies, before helping the animal through labour.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to sedate a pig so he can replace its broken nose ring, but the task proves much harder than expected.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A demanding dad dominates his daughter's shopping trip, while another father of the bride expects answers when a custom fitting goes wrong.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Dana takes her two bridesmen to her appointment, while Akisha brings along her fiance's best man, hoping a male perspective will help her reach a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Fashion director Monte comes to the rescue when a client lands in hot water, while 35-year-old Erin's mother reminds her she is not a young bride.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Lisa Chimes is under pressure to help a puppy that has been trampled on by its owner, while Dr Chris Brown travels to Adelaide to check on an extremely aggressive Peccary.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to Abu Dhabi after a special invitation to visit an extraordinary veterinary hospital, where sick and injured falcons are treated like royalty.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Ashley, who at 670 pounds is desperate to save her life and her marriage to husband David. She is also hopeful weight-loss surgery can give her the chance for a family of her own.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: After successful gastrectomy procedures, Dreier twins Kandi and Brandi lost over 400lbs. This update reveals finds them working toward skin surgeries when a major life event disrupts their world.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: The work of a bridal salon specialising in gowns for plus-size women. Yukia and Yuneisia service curvier brides, from Christen, who lost her father as a child, and Zoe, a plus-size shop owner, to Gabby, who ordered her dress a size too small.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Yukia Walker gets the chance to recreate her own wedding photos and become the bride she always wanted to be. Plus, Jennifer comes to the salon with a big entourage.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Whitney Thompson, the first 'curvy' winner of America's Next Top Model, joins Yukia and Yuneisia to revamp a vintage dress that seems to be in questionable condition.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: A bride-to-be thinks she has lost her figure after giving birth, and a customer wants a colourful dress to wear to the reception.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Yukia considers weight loss surgery as her diabetes gets worse, while a bride visits the shop looking for a dramatic outfit.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.sub-title: Don't Judge a Book by its Cover
programme.desc: Yukia and Yuneisia think the outside of the shop gives the wrong impression, and plan a major redesign.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Diana, Yukia and Yuneisia's mother, decides to get in on her daughters' business as a dress consultant, and ends up hi-jacking one of their appointments.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: The store hosts a sample sale, and the staff has to contend with a long line of customers in search of a bargain.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Amy works on a whimsical custom gown, and a special request takes everyone by surprise.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: Yukia and Yuneisia need a night out, and a bride visits the shop accompanied by nine bridesmaids.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Bindi and the keepers get Sophie the baby giraffe ready for her first steps into her enclosure, Robert helps to raise another baby - Melman the kangaroo.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt discusses his childhood and the surgeries he had to cope with, while Amy helps Zach through an encounter with a bully. The lives of American dwarf family the Roloffs.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt Roloff takes his two sons - one short, the other of average height - to a Little People of America conference, hoping to do a spot of matchmaking.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner team up to find out why a woman was separated from her birth family when she was two. The miraculous journey resolves many family mysteries.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of Levi Bellfield, who denied his connection to a series of murders and rapes. However, videotaped police interviews told a different story.

programme.title: The 50 Stone Man: Shocking Story
programme.desc: The story of obese man John Keitz who spent seven years in bed because his body could not support his weight, but died shortly after embarking on a weight-loss programme.

programme.title: The 685lb Teen
programme.desc: Justin Williamson is the most overweight teenager in the US and everyday life is tough. However, he has two goals - to get healthy and launch a singing career. This is his story.
